alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 6:56PM CDT until March 26 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT /4 AM CDT/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. 1 inch of additional accumulation expected, with locally higher amounts possible in southwest Nebraska. Winds from the northwest at 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy and Hitchcock Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT /4 AM CDT/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with accumulating snow and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 555 PM MDT /655 PM CDT/ this afternoon, a band of moderate to heavy snow has developed over Dundy and Hitchcock counties in Nebraska. Near blizzard conditions can be expected with this band through 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ this evening. This includes Highway 34 from Benkelman east to Culbertson and Highway 61 from Benkelman north to Enders.
info.instruction: If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
